title: Errors in exported hatch pattern files (.pat)

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Bug that stops user from using the tool or a major portion of pyRevit functionality [class]

labels.name: Prioritize
labels.description: The issue is planned to be resolved in the next version

labels.name: Tools
labels.description: Issues related to pyRevit commands [subsystem]

body: **Describe the bug** Error 1: Exported .PAT files do not correctly follow the rules for hatch pattern definitions. There is no comma generated between the fifth and sixth terms in each line of the definition, so the two terms are concatenated into a meaningless number which includes two decimal points. AutoCAD and Revit reject the files when trying to import because they are syntactically incorrect. Error 2: File naming convention of the exported file does not match the pattern definition name. The export process appears to alter the pattern name when making the file. It appears that hyphens are removed from the file name. Once upon a time this caused a problem in AutoCAD when creating a custom pattern by importing a file from a PAT file (if the file name and the pattern name defintion did not match exactly, it caused an error.) I am unsure if this is still an issue in current versions of AutoCAD, as I very rarely use it for production these days. Revit does not seem to care what the file name is. **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Go to 'Make Pattern' 2. Click on 'Export PAT file' 3. Open the generated PAT file 4. See error **Expected behavior** A functional pattern definition file that can be imported into AutoCAD or Revit. **Screenshots** Screenshot shows an exported file and illustrates the two noted errors. The highlighted markup shows where there should be a comma. Also, compare the file name shown at the top and the name of the pattern definition within the file itself (line 9). The hyphen has been removed in the file name and the words are concatenated together into "BrickNorman". The pattern name is defined as "Brick-Norman". **Desktop (please complete the following information):** - OS: Windows 10 - pyRevit Version 4.8.11.22103+0000-wip - pyRevit Environment: - "C:\Users\Todd>pyrevit env ==> Registered Clones (full git repos) ==> Registered Clones (deployed from archive/image) master | Deploy: "basepublic" | Branch: "master" | Version: "4.8.10.22040+1743" | Path: "C:\Users\Todd\AppData\Roaming\pyRevit-Master" ==> Attachments Unnamed-363FBF8 | Product: "Autodesk Revit 2023" | Engine: IPY277 (277) | Path: "C:\Program Files\pyRevit-Master" | AllUsers Unnamed-363FBF8 | Product: "Autodesk Revit 2022" | Engine: IPY277 (277) | Path: "C:\Program Files\pyRevit-Master" | AllUsers Unnamed-363FBF8 | Product: "Autodesk Revit 2021" | Engine: IPY277 (277) | Path: "C:\Program Files\pyRevit-Master" | AllUsers Unnamed-363FBF8 | Product: "Autodesk Revit 2020" | Engine: IPY277 (277) | Path: "C:\Program Files\pyRevit-Master" | AllUsers Unnamed-363FBF8 | Product: "Autodesk Revit 2019" | Engine: IPY277 (277) | Path: "C:\Program Files\pyRevit-Master" | AllUsers ==> Installed Extensions ==> Default Extension Search Path C:\Users\Todd\AppData\Roaming\pyRevit\Extensions ==> Extension Search Paths ==> Extension Sources - Default https://github.com/eirannejad/pyRevit/raw/master/extensions/extensions.json ==> Extension Sources - Additional ==> Installed Revits Autodesk Revit 2023 | Version: 23.0.11.19 | Build: 20220503_1030(x64) | Language: 1033 | Path: "C:\Program Files\Autodesk\Revit 2023\" Autodesk Revit 2022 | Version: 22.1.30.34 | Build: 20220520_1515(x64) | Language: 1033 | Path: "C:\Program Files\Autodesk\Revit 2022\" Autodesk Revit 2021 | Version: 21.1.70.21 | Build: 20220517_1515(x64) | Language: 1033 | Path: "C:\Program Files\Autodesk\Revit 2021\" Autodesk Revit 2020 | Version: 20.2.90.12 | Build: 20220517_1515(x64) | Language: 1033 | Path: "C:\Program Files\Autodesk\Revit 2020\" Autodesk Revit 2019 | Version: 19.2.60.3 | Build: 20220224_1700(x64) | Language: 1033 | Path: "C:\Program Files\Autodesk\Revit 2019\" ==> Running Revit Instances Error: Object reference not set to an instance of an object. Run with "--debug" option to see debug messages" `pyrevit env` **Additional context** I have not attempted to generate any "drafting" type hatch pattern files, so, I do not know if this bug is unique to model pattern definition files when exported as PAT files.

title: Possible conflict with Dynamo in Revit 2023

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Bug that stops user from using the tool or a major portion of pyRevit functionality [class]

labels.description: Issues related to loading pyRevit runtime [subsystem]

body:
**Describe the bug**
It looks like version 4.8.11 had some impact on Dynamo for Revit 2023.  I had issues with pyRevit running on 2023 and used the pyRevit_4.8.11.22151_signed.exe installer to fix that issue.  However, after running a script, Dynamo would throw an error.  Upon reopening, Dynamo would be unresponsive when adding nodes, or opening a script.  The 3d graph environment had been modified, and the nodes would also be unusable.  

Reference issue from Dynamo Github: https://github.com/DynamoDS/Dynamo/issues/13120

After uninstalling pyRevit, Dynamo seems back to normal.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Windows 11 Pro
 - pyRevit 4.8.11.22151
 - pyRevit Environment: I had to uninstall.
 - Revit: 23.0.11.19  20220503_1030(x64)

body:
**Describe the bug**
After following the advice to install the dev branch version of pyRevit for Revit 2023 compatibility, I began testing common tools that our office uses to prep for our transition to R2023. Sum Total tool does not work. Here's the forum post that recommends the dev branch: https://discourse.pyrevitlabs.io/t/error-message-loading-pyrevit-in-2023/948 

Here's the pyRevit version I have installed: 4.8.11.22151

This issue may be caused by an API change between R2022 and R2023. Tool still functions normally in R2022.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Install Revit 2023 through the Autodesk Desktop App
2. Install pyRevit 4.8.11.22151 via pyRevit_4.8.11.22151_signed.exe found at Actions > Update Units.py (#1534)
3. Open a new blank project in R2023
4. Draw some detail lines
5. Select detail lines and then click Sum Total button

**Expected behavior**
Sum tool should open selector to allow user to choose which parameter to Sum

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Windows 10 Pro 21H2
 - pyRevit Version: 4.8.11.22151
 - pyRevit Environment:
 ```

==> Registered Clones (deployed from archive/image)

body:
Using the Print Sheets command I am printing by sheet list.  

- The sheet list has a filter by issue date
- The printer is Bluebeam PDF
- The Page settings are a company standard sheet, grayscale
- I checked the combine into one PDF box

It all prints out as expected.  The problem is in the Project Browser.  The sheets that are printed thru the Print Sheets command have a character prefix added (an arrow pointing right) to the sheet number. I have to rename each sheet that was printed to the original sheet number to get them to go back to their original sheet order.

Our office went to test the Keynote Manager in BIM 360. 
First I opened the BIM 360 hosted Revit file.
Then I clicked the Keynote Manager button.
I was able to see and alter keynotes as expected. ![2021-01-26_09h16_13](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/78040384/105880638-71a21180-5fb8-11eb-8f3d-82f987452926.png)
Then I had a colleague open the same BIM 360 hosted Revit file.
Then I synchronized my version of the BIM 360 hosted Revit file.
Then my colleague did the same.
Initially, he could see all the keynotes in the Keynote Manager but then when reopening the Keynote Manager he could no longer see the project user keynotes and instead saw a blank sent of 10 misc. keynotes.
![MicrosoftTeams-image (5)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/78040384/105880627-6b139a00-5fb8-11eb-8a56-402b3089748f.png)

I know there is a working file created by Keynote Manager and maybe this is just user error, I believe there was possibly some instruction I overlooked when the Keynote Manager was first initialized. 

Thanks in advance.

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Bug that stops user from using the tool or a major portion of pyRevit functionality [class]

body:
Pyrevit addin used to work perfectly, however recently after a reinstallation of pyrevit, when I click the print sheet button, my entire revit 2018 session crashes. I have tried to reinstall both pyrevit and revit but had no luck with either.

The only work around I was able to find was by temporarily removing the addin from the folder where it is located and moving it back. This only works if I have the model fully loaded into revit, then I would remove the addin and re-add it again. After pyrevit loads back into revit, no crashing behaviour is observer. However, if I close revit and reopen again, my revit crashes as soon as I click the "print sheet" button. The only was is if I remove and re-add the plugin each time I use revit.

This is folder where I am in removing and re-adding the plugin: C:\Users\cwei\AppData\Roaming\Autodesk\Revit\Addins\2018

The workaround is not such a big problem, but I can only have 1 revit session open at a time for this to work. We often have many revit models open and the add and re-adding of the plugin only works for 1 revit session that is currently open.

Any advice or help would be greatly appreciated. Thanks in advance!

title: Error determining current attached clone

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Bug that stops user from using the tool or a major portion of pyRevit functionality [class]

body:
**Describe the bug**
Pyrevit > Setting always thow up :
`ERROR [Settings] Error determining current attached clone.`
also, engines dropdown is empty

**To Reproduce**
1. Installation (from an admin account)
```
pyrevit clone prcore corex --dest="c:\pyrevit"
pyrevit attach prcore 277 --installed --allusers
```
2 . Open revit (non admin user)
3. Pyrevit > Settings

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11913101/83487223-4407d580-a4c8-11ea-8d4c-d849314e1706.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11913101/83487287-66015800-a4c8-11ea-9d3b-ab3590728a42.png)


**Possible Fix**
I did some digging and found out this
https://github.com/eirannejad/pyRevit/blob/c068953a0fdd5489561b3f74e5d9290de3fdd5db/dev/pyRevitLabs/pyRevitLabs.PyRevit/PyRevitAttachments.cs#L132

Its being called here, when clicking settings
https://github.com/eirannejad/pyRevit/blob/c068953a0fdd5489561b3f74e5d9290de3fdd5db/pyrevitlib/pyrevit/userconfig.py#L614

changing this line, fixed the issue
`return PyRevit.PyRevitAttachments.GetAttached(int(HOST_APP.version),allUsers = True)`

Not sure if this is actually an issue or if I'm the only one facing this. Any feedback would be helpful
Thanks

title: _inc_or_dec_string increments "9" as "0" instead of "10"

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Bug that stops user from using the tool or a major portion of pyRevit functionality [class]

body:
**Describe the bug**
Hey Ehsan!

There is a reaaally small bug which can lead to larger problems (already can cause a loop in "ReNumber").

For some reason `coreutils._inc_or_dec_string(str_id=9, shift=1)` returns `0` instead of `10`. With further dozens it works correctly.

I was trying to find a quick solution, but afraid to break something else. 

Could you have a look, please?

The logger.warning on line 133 of this tool's script.py is called for each placeholder sheet in the model. I have tried this in the latest 4.5 and beta 4.6.

title: Method used to get User Desktop path fails for UNC paths

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Bug that stops user from using the tool or a major portion of pyRevit functionality [class]

body:
The USER_DESKTOP variable set in `__init__.py` returns null when userprofile desktop is set to a UNC path. This causes several extensions to fail, most notably the Print extensions.

I'm using a workaround in our organization that modifies `__init__.py` (beginning at line 460):
```
USER_DESKTOP_PATH = op.expandvars('%userprofile%\\desktop')
if op.isdir(USER_DESKTOP_PATH):
	USER_DESKTOP = USER_DESKTOP_PATH
else:
	USER_DESKTOP = 'c:\Temp'
```

title: Problem with Print Ordered Sheet Index_Revit 2016- Sequel

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Bug that stops user from using the tool or a major portion of pyRevit functionality [class]

body:
Hi Ehsan

I see you closed out our previous thread in which I think we resolved the corruption and ordering issues of sheet names. 

I would like to resolve the issue of getting a sheet set printed which corresponds to the sheets listed in a schedule. I have attached an image of the sheet schedule which lists a grand total of 126 sheets to be printed. I have set up 2 Filters which restrict the schedule to certain sheets which have a sheet number that contains N23 and a Sheet Category which contains 90&. The sheet schedule correctly lists those sheets and does not contain other sheets which do not meet those filters.

The PyRevit Tools list those sheets as 125 sheets which may makes sense since it starts with Zero. But when I print that set to PDF it prints 147 sheets. The good news is that it has printed the 126 sheets in the correct order but it has also printed an additional 21 sheets that have been added to the set. Those 21 additional sheets are checked in the Revit Print Range dialog box but they shouldn't be printed if PyRevit is controlling the printing from its own interface. I have had similar problems in the past with the Revit dialog box limiting the number of sheets printed from PyRevit according to which sheets are checked in the Revit Dialog box. For Instance PyRevit printed only 12 sheets from the same sheet schedule containing 126 sheets because the Revit Print range only had 12 sheets checked. I shouldn't have to go to the Revit Print Range and manually update this number to correspond to the number of sheets listed in the Sheet schedule.

What is the interaction between the Revit Print Range Dialog and the PyRevit interface? If the Revit Print dialog controls the number of sheets printed as seems to be the case then it seems that PyRevit is not updating the Revit Print range before it prints.

Let me know what more information you need

And thank again for your help

Greg


![20180811_1343_pyrevit_print sheets from schedule_126_125](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41219070/43996198-6370f898-9d72-11e8-811c-2a92600da737.png)
![20180811_1343_pyrevit_print sheets from schedule_126_125_bluebeam prints 147 sheets](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41219070/43996199-6389e3a8-9d72-11e8-9fe8-cb20810e4279.png)
Greg

body:
Hello

In case if I'm working through proxy pyRevit updating fails with warning: **No internet access detected. Skipping update.**

I've found a place where it stucks. In `check_internet_connection` in a row `client = WebRequest.Create(url_to_open)` python throws an exception:
`The remote server returned an error: (407) Proxy Authentication Required.`

With my python and proxy experience it would look normal if not one thing. If I just skip internet checking, e.g. with replacing `can_update` function content to:
```
def can_access(url_to_open):
    return True
```
it will updates pyRevit and all installed extensions perfectly without any errors.

In addition, I tried to go back to urllib2 internet checking and it helped also.

What do you think, could it be fixed or it's a python+proxy issue?

Thank you

title: Clarification about Instructions for push buttons

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Bug that stops user from using the tool or a major portion of pyRevit functionality [class]

body:
As per instructions (pasted below),  
 **Icon:** 
_1005_Revit_PushButton_BIM.png_  
 Generates a button labeled "BIM" in the a panel section named Revit. 

**Script** 
_BIM_getCentralPath.py_
Attaches this script to the button above, as a pushButton, labeled BIM. 

Below, it states that this button _will be labeled "get_CentraPath"_
Is that correct? Seems like the 2 statements contradict each other. 

---

Step 1: Create a .png file, with this naming pattern: __PushButton_.png 
Example: 1005_Revit_PushButton_BIM.png defines a sub-panel under pyRevit named Revit, and a simple Push Buttons in this panel named BIM.

 The startup script will expect to find only one script with name pattern similar to Method 1, and will assign it to this push button. 

Step 2: All .py script under the home directory should have the below name pattern: _.py. For the example above, BIM_getCentralPath.pywill be assigned to the push button described above. The button name will be getCentralPath
